poem:
**Riot Women**

In the humdrum haze of daily demise,  
Beth finds the pulse of a buried roar.  
A requiem of complaints births a rebellion—  
shards of silence morph into sound.  
Invisible chords twang from age-old strings;  
the echoes declare the body's own jazz.  
Against the discord, she rediscovers  
her own loud, defiant symphony.
